trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of Inosine Supplements on Markers of Bone Health
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effects of oral inosine supplements on bone turnover markers in healthy post-menopausal women

interventions.interventions: Inosine 500mg tablets (2 tablets in the morning, 1 tablet in the evening) for 6 months. Adherence will be assessed by tablet counts of returned tablets.
interventions.comparator: Placebo tablets (2 tablets in the morning, 1 tablet in the evening) consisting of lactose, microcrystalline cellulose, and magnesium stearate.

primaryOutcome.outcome: 1. Change in P1NP using serum samples
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: 2. Change in ßCTx using serum samples
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months
Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months
Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months
Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: All adverse events (as defined by the FDA)
Change in grip strength using hand dynamometer
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in lipid profile (LDL, HDL, TG) using a serum assay
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months
Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months
Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in fractional excretion of uric acid (FEUA) calculated from both serum and urine assays
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months
Measured at 6 weeks, 3 months and 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Serious adverse events (as defined by the FDA)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: a. Age >55 years b. Post-menopausal c. Female d. eGFR >60ml/min e. Serum urate <0.42mmol/L f. Able to provide written informed consent and attend study visits
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: a. Bone mineral density T score <-2.5 at the total hip, femoral neck or lumbar spine b. Previous fragility fracture of the hip or clinical spine fracture c. Current or past use of bisphosphonate therapy within 12 months, or any past zoledronate use d. Use of hormone replacement therapy within 12 months e. History of gout f. History of kidney stones g. History of diabetes mellitus h. Diuretic use i. Urine pH less than 5.0 (risk factor for uric acid urolithiasis) j. Current use of inosine as a nutritional supplement

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A number of observational studies have indicated that urate has positive effects on bone. Inosine is a nutritional supplement (available as an over the counter supplement ) that increases serum urate levels. We plan a six month randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of 120 postmenopausal female participants. Participants will be randomised to one of two groups (60 participants per group): either placebo or inosine 1.5g daily (1g morning, 500mg evening). The coprimary endpoints will be change in markers of bone health (P1NP and ßCTX). Key secondary endpoints will be measures of kidney function, blood pressure and other features of metabolic syndrome.
